thread.title: Watertown sets national unbeaten streak record
thread.title_full: Watertown sets national unbeaten streak record

title: Watertown sets national unbeaten streak record
text:
Watertown High field hockey team sets record by playing 154 games without a loss THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   9:52   9:52   
Subjects: 
Massachusetts (550) 

WATERTOWN, Massachusetts — A Massachusetts high school field hockey team has set a national record by putting together a 154-game unbeaten streak. 
Watertown beat Melrose 6-0 on Wednesday to set the mark. 
Watertown (16-0), which has won six consecutive state championships, has not lost since the Division 2 state tournament semifinals in the fall of 2008. 
Eileen Donahue, who has coached the team for 30 years, called the victory "an emotional moment" but said it probably won't sink in until the end of the season. 
The streak includes just three ties and the team has shut out 40 of its last 41 opponents. 
The previous record was set by Eastern High School of Voorhees, New Jersey, from 1999 to 2005 according to the National Federation of State High School Associations.
